Articles.Content:
I have built a large manned rover in ksp to rescue downed pilots and it has been through various stages, however i have never been able to drive it more than a few km or kerbal before it tips over. so at first i think to myself: hmmm, need to make it wider. but no! even with masses of struts keeping it longer and wider than those orange tanks, when on full speed it just tips after a few km.

any ideas or help? i wanted to keep one side level with a docking port to allow multiple rover interfaces, but that should be ok for driving over the perfectly flat ground immediately surrounding ksc right?
Images please. From the description, though, there might be something that is hitting the ground and causing your rover to tip over because of it.
